Reprisal.definition: the act or practice in international law of resorting to force short of war in retaliation for damage or loss suffered b
Reprisal.origin: [Anglo-French reprisaile reprisaille , from Middle French, from Old Italian ripresaglia , from ripreso , past participle of riprendere to take back, from ri- back + prendere to take, from Latin prehendere ]

1 a.definition: the act or practice in international law of resorting to force short of war in retaliation for damage or loss suffered

2.definition: a retaliatory act [may not fire a complaining employee in ]
